{
  "article_text": [
    "binary sequences generated by chaotic maps have been widely studied . in particular ,",
    "the logistic map is used as one of the chaotic map , which is defined by a polynomial of degree two over the interval @xmath0 $ ] . however ,",
    "if the logistic map is implemented by using finite precision computer arithmetic , rounding is required . in order to avoid rounding ,",
    "miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami proposed the logistic map over a finite field ( for details , see section [ section : sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields ] ) .",
    "let @xmath1 and @xmath2 be a prime number and the finite field with @xmath1 elements , respectively . in @xcite and @xcite ,",
    "miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami defined the logistic map over @xmath2 and studied sequences generated by the logistic map over @xmath2 . in @xcite ,",
    "miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami studied properties of sequences when @xmath1 is a safe prime , where @xmath1 is a safe prime ( or @xmath3-safe prime ) if there is a prime number @xmath4 such that @xmath5 . in @xcite ,",
    "miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami studied properties of sequences when @xmath1 is a doubly safe prime , where a safe prime @xmath5 is a doubly safe prime ( or @xmath6-safe prime ) if @xmath4 is a safe prime . in particular",
    ", they showed that there exists a sequence which has period length @xmath7 by numerical experiments . in @xcite , miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami showed the existence of an automorphism between two maps with different parameters . in @xcite , miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami studied correlations for sequences .",
    "the aim of this paper is to give some properties of periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields with control parameter four .",
    "we show conditions for parameters and initial values to have a long period .",
    "these conditions are weaker than the ones showed in @xcite and @xcite .",
    "moreover we show asymptotic properties for periods by numerical experiments .",
    "conditions for initial values are described by values of the legendre symbol .",
    "the main idea is to introduce a structure of a hyperbola to certain sets of initial values .",
    "on the other hand , we can regard sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields as quadratic congruential pseudorandom number sequences modulo primes .",
    "quadratic congruential generators are a type of nonlinear congruential pseudorandom number generators . as nonlinear congruential pseudorandom number generators ,",
    "inversive congruential generators ( eichenauer and lehn @xcite ) and power congruential generators ( lagarias @xcite , lucheta , miller and reiter @xcite , chou and shparlinski @xcite ) have widely been studied ( see niederreiter @xcite ) .",
    "knuth @xcite introduced quadratic congruential generators and showed the conditions for sequences which have a period of maximal length .",
    "eichenauer and lehn @xcite studied the lattice structure of quadratic congruential pseudorandom number sequences .",
    "blum , blum and shub @xcite , rogers @xcite , vasiga and shallit @xcite , somer and krizek @xcite , carlip and mincheva @xcite studied the simplest case , that is to say , the case of the iteration of the square map .",
    "some other people have widely studied quadratic congruential generators ( see eichenauer - herrmann , herrmann and wegenkittl @xcite , strandt @xcite , blaekov and strauch @xcite , blackburn , gomez - perez , gutierrez and shparlinski @xcite , bauer , vergnaud and zapalowicz @xcite and so on ) .",
    "now , we consider periods of quadratic congruential pseudorandom number sequences modulo odd primes @xmath1 . then there is no sequence which has a period of length @xmath1 ( see knuth @xcite ) . for the case that a recurrence polynomial is @xmath8 $ ] , rogers @xcite and vasiga and shallit @xcite studied state diagrams of sequences in detail .",
    "gilbert , kolesar , reiter and storey @xcite and peinado , montoya , muoz and yuste @xcite considered state diagrams of sequences for more general cases of @xmath9 $ ] . in particular , for the case of @xmath10 $ ] , vasiga and shallit @xcite studied state diagrams of sequences in detail .",
    "in fact a sequence generated by the logistic map over @xmath2 with control parameter four is transformed to a sequence defined by the polynomial @xmath11 by an automorphism .",
    "thus one can have periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over @xmath2 with control parameter four by applying the results in vasiga and shallit @xcite . because they have an interest in graph theory for a state diagram of a sequence , they have considered not only long periods but also short periods .",
    "thus they do not specify sets of initial values in which an element generates a long period sequence . in this paper ,",
    "we specify sets of initial values in which an element generates a long period sequence , and estimate periods on these sets by numerical experiments .    in section [ section :",
    "sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields ] , we define the logistic map over finite fields and sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields . in section [ section : sets of initial values and a structure of the hyperbola ] , we introduce sets of initial values which generate long period sequences . in section [ section : the square maps and periods of sequences ] , we consider periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields . in section [ section : long period sequences ] , we give some conditions for parameters to be maximal on the sets of initial values . in section",
    "[ section : numerical experiments ] , we give some experimental results on periods of sequences .",
    "we give some notations . for a prime number @xmath1",
    ", @xmath2 denotes the finite field with @xmath1 elements . for a prime number @xmath1 and an integer @xmath12",
    ", @xmath13 denotes the legendre symbol . for a finite set @xmath14",
    ", @xmath15 denotes the number of elements in @xmath14 . for a finite field @xmath2 and the quadratic extension @xmath16 of @xmath2",
    ", @xmath17 denotes the norm map , namely , @xmath18 for @xmath19 . for a finite extension of fields @xmath20 and an algebraic variety @xmath21 over @xmath22",
    ", @xmath23 denotes the weil restriction . for a finite group @xmath24 and an element @xmath25",
    ", @xmath26 denotes the order of @xmath27 in @xmath24 .",
    "in particular , if @xmath24 is the multiplicative group @xmath28 of the quotient ring @xmath29 of integers modulo @xmath30 , then we write @xmath31 .",
    "in this section , we define the logistic map over finite fields , and sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields .",
    "let @xmath1 be a prime number , and @xmath32 .",
    "we define a map @xmath33 } : \\mathbb{f}_p \\rightarrow \\mathbb{f}_p$ ] as @xmath33 } ( a ) = \\mu_p a ( a + 1)$ ] for any @xmath34 ( miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami @xcite or @xcite ) .",
    "the map @xmath33}$ ] is called the logistic map over the finite field @xmath2 with control parameter @xmath35 . if @xmath36 and @xmath37 , it is simply referred to as @xmath38 .",

    "then there exists the least positive integer @xmath42 such that @xmath43 . and , there exists the least non negative integer @xmath44 such that @xmath45 .",
    "if @xmath46 , @xmath47 is called a link of @xmath40 , and @xmath48 is called the link length of @xmath40 .",
    "@xmath49 is called a period of @xmath40 , and @xmath50 is called the period length of @xmath40 .",
    "period length of a sequence generated by a polynomial of degree two over a finite prime field of odd characteristic @xmath1 is not maximal , namely @xmath1 ( see knuth @xcite ) .",
    "so we have to consider initial values which generate long period sequences . in this section ,",
    "we specify sets of initial values in which an element generates a long period sequence by dividing a finite field into subsets determined by values of the legendre symbol . in order to analyze these sets",
    ", we introduce a structure of a hyperbola .    throughout the paper ,",

    "[ remark : parameter space as a torus ]",
    "in this section , we consider periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields with control parameter four .",
    "for understanding periods , we relate the logistic map on the sets of initial values and the square map on the parameter spaces of the hyperbola .",
    "now , we relate the logistic map on the sets of initial values and the square map on the parameter spaces of the hyperbola .",

    "lemma [ lemma : square map and logistic map1 ] and lemma [ lemma : square map and logistic map3 ] follow that periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields on the sets of initial values are induced by periods of sequences generated by the square map on the parameter spaces of the hyperbola .",

    "@xmath203 $ ] ) . by ( [ ieeeeqnarray : four to one map ] )",
    ", it follows that @xmath207 and @xmath208 .    a sequence defined as the recurrence relation ( [ equation : recurrence relation ] )",
    "is transformed to a sequence defined by the polynomial @xmath209 $ ] by an automorphism .",
    "the latter has been studied in great detail by vasiga and shallit @xcite .",
    "so one can have theorem [ theorem : link length and period length ] and theorem [ theorem : structure of period ] by applying the results in vasiga and shallit @xcite . because they have an interest in graph theory for a state diagram of a sequence , they have considered not only long periods but also short periods . on the other hand",
    ", we specified the sets @xmath74 $ ] and @xmath73 $ ] of initial values in which an element generates a sequence of long period .",
    "moreover we estimate periods on @xmath74 $ ] and @xmath73 $ ] below .",
    "we consider periods by using a structure of the hyperbola .",
    "vasiga and shallit consider periods by using the dickson polyonmial .",
    "[ remark : the case of z^2 - 2 ]",
    "applying the logistic map over finite fields to a pseudorandom number generator , we need long period sequences . in this section , we give the conditions for parameters to be maximal on the sets of initial values .",
    "moreover , we consider parallel generation of sequences",
    ".      conditions for parameters to be maximal on the sets of initial values are deduced from ( [ equation : period length ] ) .",
    "let @xmath210 be a prime number such that @xmath211 ( resp .",
    "@xmath212 ) is a prime number .",
    "assume that @xmath213 or @xmath214 let @xmath40 be a sequence defined as the recurrence relation ( [ equation : recurrence relation ] ) with @xmath167 $ ] ( resp .",
    "$ ] ) . then the sequence @xmath40 has period length @xmath215 .",
    "[ corollary : maximal sequence ]    for a prime number @xmath1 , @xmath1 is a safe prime ( or @xmath3-safe prime ) if there is a prime number @xmath4 with @xmath216 . if @xmath210 , then @xmath80 and @xmath217 . for a safe prime @xmath216 ,",
    "@xmath1 is a doubly safe prime ( or @xmath6-safe prime ) if @xmath4 is a safe prime .",
    "if @xmath216 is a doubly safe prime , then @xmath4 holds ( [ equation : primitive element ] ) or ( [ equation : half primitive element ] ) .",
    "peinado , montoya , muoz and yuste ( * ? ? ?",
    "* remark 2 ) and miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami @xcite considered in this situation . [ remark : doubly safe prime ]    a prime number @xmath1 is a maximal prime on @xmath74 $ ] ( resp . @xmath73 $ ] ) if there is a prime number @xmath210 such that @xmath5 ( resp .",
    "@xmath218 ) and @xmath4 holds ( [ equation : primitive element ] ) or ( [ equation : half primitive element ] ) .      in the case of non - maximal sequences ,",
    "there are at least two periods .",
    "if we can select two initial values which generate two diffrent periods each other , we can generate two sequences in parallel , which have no collisions .",
    "let @xmath219 be different prime numbers such that @xmath220 ( resp .",
    "@xmath221 ) is a prime number . for any @xmath222 , assume that @xmath223 or @xmath224 let @xmath225 be a primitive element of @xmath2 ( resp .",
    "@xmath226 be a primitive element of @xmath16 and @xmath227 ) .",
    "put @xmath228 . put @xmath229 ( t_1 ) , y_0 = \\phi_{3}[1 , 1 ] ( t_2)$ ] ( resp .",
    "@xmath230 ( t_1 ) , y_0 = \\phi_{1}[-1 , 1 ] ( t_2)$ ] ) .",
    "let @xmath40 and @xmath231 be sequences defined as the recurrence relation ( [ equation : recurrence relation ] ) with initial values @xmath232 and @xmath233 , respectively .",
    "then the sequence @xmath40 has period length @xmath234 and the sequence @xmath231 has period length @xmath235 .",
    "[ corollary : parallel sequence ]    by adding the condition @xmath236 , we can obtain highly independent sequences .",
    "[ remark : independence ]    if the size of @xmath237 and @xmath238 are the same , then the size of @xmath1 is about twice .",
    "[ remark : size of p ]",
    "one can expect that a sequence generated by the logistic map over a finite filed @xmath2 on @xmath73 $ ] ( resp .",
    "@xmath74 $ ] ) has a long period if @xmath78 ( resp .",
    "@xmath80 ) . in this section",
    ", we estimate a ratio of maximal primes , the number of periods and period lengths on the sets of initial values .    fix a positive integer @xmath239 .",
    "now , for @xmath240 , we show the number of @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath78 , the number of @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath80 , the ratio of @xmath239-bit maximal primes on @xmath73 $ ] in @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath78 and the ratio of @xmath239-bit maximal primes on @xmath74 $ ] in @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath80 in table [ table : the ratio of maximal primes ] , and the graph of the ratio of maximal primes on @xmath73 $ ] and @xmath74 $ ] in fig .",
    "[ figure : the ratio of maximal primes ] .",
    "table [ table : the ratio of maximal primes ] and fig .",
    "[ figure : the ratio of maximal primes ] show that both ratios are slowly decreasing and that the ratio of @xmath239-bit maximal primes on @xmath73 $ ] in @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath78 is smaller than the ratio of @xmath239-bit maximal primes on @xmath74 $ ] in @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath80 .",
    "this means that the order of @xmath6 in @xmath241 where @xmath5 tends to be larger than the order of @xmath6 in @xmath241 where @xmath218 .",
    "the cause is not clear .",
    "this observation shows that maximal primes are rare .",
    "therefore we estimate the number of periods and period lengths on the sets of initial values by applying ( [ equation : the number of period n_d ] ) and ( [ equation : period length c_d ] ) . in table",
    "[ table : the average of the number of periods and period lengths ] , for @xmath240 , we show the average of the number of periods and of the period lengths on @xmath73 $ ] ( resp .",
    "$ ] ) in @xmath239-bit primes @xmath1 with @xmath78 ( resp .",
    "@xmath80 ) . for @xmath242",
    ", we show the graph of the average of the number of periods in fig .",
    "[ figure : the average of the number of periods ] and the graph of the average of period lengths in fig .",
    "[ figure : the average of period lengths ] .",
    "table [ table : the average of the number of periods and period lengths ] , fig .",
    "[ figure : the average of the number of periods ] and fig .",
    "[ figure : the average of period lengths ] show that both averages of the number of periods and of period lengths are increasing rapidly . as in fig .",
    "[ figure : the ratio of maximal primes ] , the average of period lengths in the case of @xmath78 is smaller than the average of period lengths in the case of @xmath80 . on the other hand ,",
    "the average of the number of periods in the case of @xmath78 is almost the same as the average of the number of periods in the case of @xmath80 .",
    "in this paper , we study periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields with control parameter four .",
    "the conditions for initial values are given by values of the legendre symbol .",
    "it is crucial that periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields on the sets of initial values are induced by periods of sequences generated by the square map on the parameter spaces of the hyperbola . in particular",
    ", we show the conditions for parameters to be maximal on the sets of initial values , and estimate a ratio of maximal primes , the number of periods and period lengths on the sets of initial values .",
    "the authors would like to thank satoshi uehara , shunsuke araki and takeru miyazaki for useful discussion .",
    "in particular , the authors would like to thank satoshi uehara for his valuable comments .",

    "santa barbara , california , usa , aug . 1721 , 2003 , proc . _ , ( lecture notes in compt .",

    "s.  strandt , quadratic congruential generators with odd composite modulus ,  in _ monte carlo and quasi - monte carlo methods 1996 proc .",
    "university of salzburg , austria , july 9-12 , 1996 _ , ( lecture notes in statist .",
    "127)1em plus 0.5em minus 0.4emnew york , ny , usa : springer - verlag new york , 1998 , pp.415426 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> recently , binary sequences generated by chaotic maps have been widely studied . in particular , </S>",
    "<S> the logistic map is used as one of the chaotic map . however , if the logistic map is implemented by using finite precision computer arithmetic , rounding is required . in order to avoid rounding , miyazaki , araki , uehara and nogami proposed the logistic map over finite fields , and show some properties of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields . in this paper , we show some properties of periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields with control parameter four . in particular , we show conditions for parameters and initial values to have a long period , and asymptotic properties for periods by numerical experiments . </S>",
    "<S> conditions for initial values are described by values of the legendre symbol . </S>",
    "<S> the main idea is to introduce a structure of a hyperbola to certain sets of initial values . </S>",
    "<S> it follows that periods of sequences generated by the logistic map over finite fields on the sets of initial values are induced by periods of sequences generated by the square map on the parameter spaces of the hyperbola .    </S>",
    "<S> hyperbola , legendre symbol , logistic map over finite fields , long period sequences , square map . </S>"
  ]
}
